actor_awards.notes: Best known for his role as the guardian angel Clarence Odbody in 'It's a Wonderful Life' (1946). He was a successful character actor on stage before moving to Hollywood in his late 50s.

filmography.title: It's a Wonderful Life
filmography.role_description: An Angel Second Class who hasn't got his wings yet, sent to save a despairing George Bailey on Christmas Eve.
filmography.plot: An angel is sent from Heaven to help a desperately frustrated businessman by showing him what life would have been like if he had never existed.

filmography.title: Mrs. Miniver
filmography.role_description: A gentle stationmaster who breeds a prize-winning rose named after the protagonist.
filmography.plot: A British family struggles to survive the first months of World War II.

filmography.title: Shadow of a Doubt
filmography.role_description: The crime-obsessed, mild-mannered father of the protagonist who unknowingly hosts a serial killer.
filmography.plot: A young woman discovers her visiting uncle may not be the man he seems to be.

filmography.title: The Invisible Man
filmography.role_description: The concerned father of the Invisible Man's fiancée and his former employer.
filmography.plot: A scientist finds a way of becoming invisible, but in doing so, he becomes murderously insane.

filmography.title: High Sierra
filmography.role_description: A kind-hearted man traveling to California who befriends the gangster 'Mad Dog' Earle.
filmography.plot: After being released from prison, a bank robber tries to pull off one last heist but gets entangled with a family and a dance hall girl.

filmography.title: Ball of Fire
filmography.role_description: One of seven bachelor professors compiling an encyclopedia who get mixed up with a nightclub singer.
filmography.plot: A group of professors working on a new encyclopedia encounter a mouthy nightclub singer who is wanted by the police to help bring down her mobster lover.

filmography.title: The Bells of St. Mary's
filmography.role_description: A grumpy businessman who wants to condemn a school to build a parking lot but is softened by the nuns.
filmography.plot: At a big city Catholic school, an easygoing priest and a no-nonsense nun butt heads over how to educate the children and save the school.

filmography.title: Dark Victory
filmography.role_description: A doctor involved in the diagnosis of a socialite's terminal illness.
filmography.plot: A young socialite is diagnosed with a brain tumor and must decide whether to meet her final days with dignity.

filmography.title: The Yearling
filmography.role_description: A storekeeper who interacts with the young protagonist Jody.
filmography.plot: A boy persuades his parents to allow him to adopt a young deer, but their bond is tested by the harsh realities of farming.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Art Direction, Best Cinematography

filmography.title: Madame Curie
filmography.role_description: The father of Pierre Curie in this biographical drama about the famous scientists.
filmography.plot: The story of the Polish-French physicist Marie Curie and her discovery of radium.

filmography.title: On Borrowed Time
filmography.role_description: A doctor who witnesses the strange events when Death is trapped in a tree.
filmography.plot: An old man traps Death in an apple tree to prevent him from taking him and his grandson.

filmography.title: The Moon Is Down
filmography.role_description: The mayor of a Norwegian town occupied by Nazis who refuses to collaborate.
filmography.plot: When the Nazis invade a small Norwegian town, the people are stirred to rebellion by the mayor.
filmography.awards: National Board of Review: Top Ten Films

filmography.title: Stanley and Livingstone
filmography.role_description: The father of the woman Stanley loves in this historical adventure.
filmography.plot: Henry M. Stanley goes on a quest to find Dr. David Livingstone in the wilds of Africa.

filmography.title: Dodge City
filmography.role_description: A newspaper editor and town doctor who fights against corruption in the West.
filmography.plot: A cattle agent in Dodge City takes the job of sheriff to clean up the lawless town.

filmography.title: Death Takes a Holiday
filmography.role_description: A guest at the villa where Death assumes human form to understand why humans fear him.
filmography.plot: Death decides to take a holiday from his usual business to see what it is like to be a mortal.

filmography.title: Reunion in Vienna
filmography.role_description: His first credited film role, playing a character in this romance set in post-imperial Vienna.
filmography.plot: An exiled Archduke returns to Vienna for a reunion and tries to woo back his former mistress, who is now happily married.

filmography.title: The Naughty Nineties
filmography.role_description: The captain of a showboat that is taken over by gamblers, aided by Abbott and Costello.
filmography.plot: Abbott and Costello try to help a showboat captain reclaim his vessel from a trio of crooked gamblers.

filmography.title: The Sisters
filmography.role_description: A prominent San Francisco critic who marries one of the three sisters.
filmography.plot: Three sisters from Montana find their lives taking very different paths at the turn of the century.

filmography.title: Dragon Seed
filmography.role_description: A family member in this drama about a Chinese village invaded by the Japanese.
filmography.plot: Chinese peasants fight to survive the Japanese invasion of their village during World War II.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress (Aline MacMahon)

filmography.title: Primrose Path
filmography.role_description: The alcoholic head of a dysfunctional family in this gritty drama.
filmography.plot: A young woman from a 'shanty' family tries to hide her background from her new husband.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Supporting Actress (Marjorie Rambeau)

filmography.title: None Shall Escape
filmography.role_description: A priest who testifies against a Nazi war criminal in a fictional post-war trial.
filmography.plot: A Nazi officer's career is traced through flashbacks during his trial for war crimes.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Nomination – Best Writing, Original Story

filmography.title: Gallant Journey
filmography.role_description: A character in the biopic of aviation pioneer John Joseph Montgomery.
filmography.plot: The story of John Joseph Montgomery, who made the first controlled heavier-than-air flight in 1883.

filmography.title: The Girl from 10th Avenue
filmography.role_description: A minor role in this Bette Davis drama about a shopgirl marrying a lawyer.
filmography.plot: A working-class girl marries a society lawyer while he is drunk, leading to complications when he sobers up.

filmography.title: Seven Keys to Baldpate
filmography.role_description: A hermit involved in the mystery at the Baldpate Inn.
filmography.plot: A writer bets he can write a novel in 24 hours at a deserted inn, but he is constantly interrupted by various characters.

filmography.title: Born to Be Bad
filmography.role_description: A supporting character in this drama starring Loretta Young and Cary Grant.
filmography.plot: An unwed mother schemes to secure a future for her son by manipulating a wealthy businessman.

filmography.title: Pursuit
filmography.role_description: A role in this adventure film about an aviator hired to smuggle a child.
filmography.plot: An aviator is hired to transport a child from Mexico to the US to avoid a custody battle.
